metadata.title: CVE-2019-15927 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.20.2. An out-of-boundsaccess exists in the function build_audio_procunit in the filesound/usb/mixer.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1039.42').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
